javadoc:
The User Strings stream contains blobs of 16-bit Unicode strings.
 When the stream is present, the first entry is always the byte 0x00.
 This stream may contain garbage in its unreachable parts.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name of this stream.
@return The name of this stream.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Gets the name of this stream.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: header
params.comment: The stream header associated with this stream.

params.name: fileOffset
params.comment: The file offset where this stream starts.

params.name: rva
params.comment: The relative virtual address where this stream starts.

params.name: reader
params.comment: A reader that is set to the start of the stream.

throws.comment: if there is a problem reading the stream.

methods.name: getUserString
methods.comment: Gets the user string at the given index.

params.name: index
params.comment: The index of the user string to get.

return.comment:
The user string at the given index.  Could be null if the index was invalid or
   there was a problem reading the user string.

name: CliStreamUserStrings
comment:
The User Strings stream contains blobs of 16-bit Unicode strings.
 When the stream is present, the first entry is always the byte 0x00.
 This stream may contain garbage in its unreachable parts.
